segment.source: Link the GPO to the Domain (Windows 10)
segment.target: Link the GPO to the Domain (Windows 10)

segment.source: Link the GPO to the Domain
segment.target: Link the GPO to the Domain

segment.source: Link the GPO to the Domain
segment.target: Link the GPO to the Domain

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: After you create the GPO and configure it with security group filters and WMI filters, you must link the GPO to the container in Active Directory that contains all of the target devices.
segment.target: After you create the GPO and configure it with security group filters and WMI filters, you must link the GPO to the container in Active Directory that contains all of the target devices.

segment.source: If the filters comprehensively control the application of the GPO to only the correct devices, then you can link the GPO to the domain container.
segment.target: If the filters comprehensively control the application of the GPO to only the correct devices, then you can link the GPO to the domain container.

segment.source: Alternatively, you can link the GPO to a site container or organizational unit if you want to limit application of the GPO to that subset of devices.
segment.target: Alternatively, you can link the GPO to a site container or organizational unit if you want to limit application of the GPO to that subset of devices.

segment.source: Administrative credentials
segment.target: Administrative credentials

segment.source: To complete this procedure, you must be a member of the Domain Admins group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the GPOs.
segment.target: To complete this procedure, you must be a member of the Domain Admins group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the GPOs.

segment.source: To link the GPO to the domain container in Active Directory
segment.target: To link the GPO to the domain container in Active Directory

segment.source: Open the Group Policy Management console.
segment.target: Open the Group Policy Management console.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, expand Forest:YourForestName, expand Domains, and then expand YourDomainName.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, expand Forest:YourForestName, expand Domains, and then expand YourDomainName.

segment.source: Right-click YourDomainName, and then click Link an Existing GPO.
segment.target: Right-click YourDomainName, and then click Link an Existing GPO.

segment.source: In the Select GPO dialog box, select the GPO that you want to deploy, and then click OK.
segment.target: In the Select GPO dialog box, select the GPO that you want to deploy, and then click OK.

segment.source: The GPO appears in the Linked Group Policy Objects tab in the details pane and as a linked item under the domain container in the navigation pane.
segment.target: The GPO appears in the Linked Group Policy Objects tab in the details pane and as a linked item under the domain container in the navigation pane.

segment.source: You can adjust the order of the linked GPOs to ensure that the higher priority GPOs are processed last.
segment.target: You can adjust the order of the linked GPOs to ensure that the higher priority GPOs are processed last.

segment.source: Select a GPO and click the up or down arrows to move it.
segment.target: Select a GPO and click the up or down arrows to move it.

segment.source: The GPOs are processed by the client device from the highest link order number to the lowest.
segment.target: The GPOs are processed by the client device from the highest link order number to the lowest.
